questions.question: What is the main goal of the research presented in the paper?
questions.answer: The main goal is to report a new strategy for ligand design that uses piperazine and dihydrophenazine units as substitutes for benzene rings, enabling the transition metal catalyst-free construction of new carboxylate-based ligands and structurally diverse MOFs with large pore sizes and volumes.

questions.question: What are the expected benefits of using piperazine-based ligands in MOF synthesis?
questions.answer: Piperazine-based ligands are expected to offer stronger metal-ligand bonds due to higher charge density on the carboxylate, possibly boosting the stability of the resulting MOFs.
